plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub known for its large, vibrant flowers that can be red, pink, orange, yellow, or white. It blooms year-round in tropical climates and is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical regions, peaks in summer
plants.location: Tropical regions worldwide, including Southeast Asia and Pacific Islands
plants.funFact: Each hibiscus flower blooms for just one day but is continuously replaced by new blooms.

plants.name: Heliotropium arborescens
plants.description: A fragrant annual or perennial plant with clusters of small purple, white, or lavender flowers. It thrives in summer and early autumn gardens in temperate zones.
plants.location: Originally from Peru, commonly grown in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Heliotrope's name derives from 'helios' (sun) and 'tropos' (turn), as its flowers historically were thought to turn to face the sun.

plants.name: Hydrangea macrophylla
plants.description: A deciduous shrub that produces large, ball-shaped clusters of flowers, with color depending on soil pH (blue in acidic soils, pink in alkaline). Typically blooms mid-summer through early autumn.
plants.location: Native to Japan, widely cultivated in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: The flower color can be changed by adjusting soil pHâ€”aluminum availability influences bloom color.

plants.name: Epilobium angustifolium
plants.description: A fast-growing wildflower with tall spikes of bright pink to purple flowers, common in disturbed areas and boreal forests. It blooms prolifically in late summer after forest fires or clearings.
plants.location: Boreal and temperate regions of North America and Eurasia
plants.funFact: Fireweed is one of the first plants to colonize areas after forest fires, hence the name.
